full_text:
I have yet to even witness the planchette move on it's own accord.

I have conducted experiments using my gadgets - EMF, Temp gauges, Recording
devices...I have yet to get a single hit on any one of those devices during
a Ouija session, even when I have asked the "entity" to do so, to which it
always agrees.

I would agree with John and others. I think it is far more plausible that
the Ouija board is nothing more then us talking to ourselves. But again, I
am always open to the opportunity to be proven wrong.

>>>  As has been said, one of  the most likely explanations for the Ouija is
>>> the working of the mind.
>>> What is somewhat at issue, as is so often the case when discussing
>>> apparent discarnate
>>> communications, is the actual source of the apparent intelligence.
>>>
>>> Micromuscular reactions do indeed appear to be one source of the Ouija
>>> when operators are
>>> in contact with the planchette. But this is only one category of Ouija
>>> interactions. There is
>>> another completely different category where no operator is touching the
>>> board or the planchette,
>>> and yet it moves and remains in motion, often changing directions or
>>> flying off the board. This
>>> type of activity is more akin to psychokinesis, the mind affecting the
>>> environment.
>>>
>>> Both types of activity could be mediated in the mind of a living
>>> operator, and in fact modern
>>> parapsychology research suggest this is the most reasonable explanation.
>>> But again the
>>> source of the information thus presented is at question and is currently
>>> unknown.
>>>
>>> Against this backdrop it would seem that it would be quite difficult to
>>> demonstrate with
>>> any clarity or precision that any specific individual (living or
>>> deceased) was indeed affecting
>>> the Ouija (or any other device for that matter). It would all come down
>>> to beliefs which is the
>>> best we can hope for at this time.
>>>
>>> So 'scientific' proof per se is off the table if you define 'scientific'
>>> in the classic sense.
>>> If you mean objective proof, in some way documenting activity such as by
>>> video for example,
>>> that is a different matter. But to be very clear, this would not be
>>> considered scientific proof
>>> because you are cannot demonstrate the causation. You can however
>>> document the effect.
>>>
>>> Blood Mary (the ritual of Mary Worth) is considered by most to be
>>> folk-legend. So it would
>>> be difficult, would it not, to ascertain who in fact you were
>>> communicating with. And again,
>>> there is a real possiblity, based on existing lab research from the past
>>> many decades that
>>> you just might be communicating with yourself.
>>>
>>> Best of luck in your endeavors!
>>>
